page.title: 04EDUCATION CHARDSTOCK SCHOOL
page.content: St Andrews School opposite the church was built in the year 1839 by the Revd Charles Woodcock.He then added an industrial school for training serving girls in domestic service.In 1856 he built a college next to the school.The remains of the college can still be seen today.The school is now a C of E Aided Primary School.It has 45 children between the ages of 5 & 11.There are two main classes the Infants & Juniors.The Infants teacher is Mrs.A.Martin and the Junior class is taken by the Headmaster Mr.P.J.Wood.We use the old college hall for gymnastics which is taken by Mrs.P.Jones."The Friends of the School Association"have helped to provide a lot of equipment-Computer Duplicator Microscope & P.E. apparatus. At 11+ children move either to Axminster or Colyton Grammar or Chard Comprehesive.
